title: Thunderbird: 'get new messages for all accounts' skips one single account out of four
content:
I configured thunderbird to manage four different email accounts. unfortunately the 'get new messages for all accounts' skips one single account.

on the other hand 'get new messages for the - skipped - account' works perfect.

remark: out of the three accounts that work, there is one which only differs from the not-working one in respect of its email-address, everything else is setup the same way. nevertheless one is considered by 'get new messages for all accounts', the other isn't.

any idea on how to solve that easily?

thank you in advance.

sincerely, giorgio
creator: ftpftp

title: TB not parsing version number to MS Azure => not compliant
content:
IT services recently introduced some further security measures that require s/w to parse version numbers to Azure to ensure that 3rd party s/w is compliant. Apparently Firefox has this feature enabled but TB does not. Here is what IT services told me as to why TB is not compliant and does not work any more:

"The truthful answer to whether Thunderbird will ever be compliant is we just don't know. The issue lies with Mozilla not having yet implemented a feature now available in Firefox to enable the app to report back to Azure what version it is.

I suspect Thunderbird may have an inbuilt/embedded browser as this is something also observed in other apps."

Do you know if TB will be updated so that it will be compliant? I imagine this issue will become increasingly a problem. I have copied the error message I get when trying to access email.
creator: jlbamber1

title: E-mails
content:
I've started getting the occasional E-mail that contains what I call "machine language", for example:

- -5d5c783f61d4728a71c3d3685909afd9fa5da34e08d1c2fe4db96174a375

The E-mail does contain unusable snippets of intelligible language and several blue hyperlinks. There is no "From" or "Subject" listed, and the buttons "Reply", "Forward", etc. are missing.

Anyone have any idea why this is happening and how to fix it?

Please reply to <MilusC@aol.com>
creator: MilusC1

title: Version 102.10.1 has many ways to change font size
content:
In version 102.10.1 I can change the font size of the various Thunderbird panes independently. I've used the layout.css.devPixelsPerPx variable in the Config Editor to get the menu, folder index, headings, and other fixed parts of the UI to a reasonable size, but the message pane, reply quote, and other parts of the displayed text are way too large. I've tried to use the font size controls in Settings to adjust them, but with little luck.

So, what I would like to see is a concise table showing each font size parameter and exactly which panes and text it applies to. Or, I would like to see written instructions for making the font size the same for all text appearing in Thunderbird, anywhere in Thunderbird.

Or any other answer that is equivalent to these to help me achieve the same font size throughout Thunderbird.

Note: while I can see that some text is too large, I have not verified that a recipient would see text that is too large, since I'm not certain how to test for this, or how to text for both plain text and formatted text. I prefer to send plain text and receive formatted text, if that is relevant.
creator: David536

title: Drag and drop

title: Startup Problem
content:
I am running Thunderbird version 102 on Fedora 38. I have a fast computer.

When I click on the Thunderbird icon to start, all I get is a blank window and nothing else happens. I then close the window and again click on the Thunderbird icon. Nothing happens. I again click on the Thunderbird icon and it start normally with no problems.

If I restart my computer I can start Thunderbird with only one click of the icon, if I shutdown my computer and start, then the problem occurs all over again.

Thank you for reading this, Joe
creator: joehesse

title: Two email accounts on single SMTP server
content:
I have two separate email accounts that worked independently until yesterday. Now when I go to "Edit SMTP Server", any change to either account (e.g. Description, Server Name, User Name) changes both accounts. That places one account out of sync with its authorizing email address and I get the following error message if I try to send from that account:

"Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <xxx@cfl.rr.com> sender rejected. The email address you are sending as must match the email address you used to auth. Please check your SMTP settings. AUP#Out-1500. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again."

It appears that Thunderbird no longer allows two different User Names on one SMTP server. Or I don't know how to do it. Is this a Thunderbird problem?
creator: tulley
